com.soa.message
Interface Exchange

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractExchange, SimpleExchange, SOAPExchange
public interface Exchange

Properties about the current message exchange. The context consists of the operation the message is invoking and optional properties that can be read and altered by message handlers. In contrast to Message properties which are only available while processing one message, the properties of the ExchangeContext are present for the duration of the exchange, which includes the processing of an input message and a corresponding output or fault message (if any).

Since:
5.0

getPropertyNames

java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
Returns the names of the properties associated with the context. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the context, so if a name is removed from the Set, the property is removed from the context. Names cannot be added however.

Returns:
Set of String property names.

getProperties

java.util.Map getProperties()
Provides direct access to the Map of properties for the exchange.

Returns:
Map of properties keyed by Strings.

setProperties

void setProperties(java.util.Map properties)
Replaces the properties of the exchange in one call for optimization.

Parameters:
properties - Map of properties keyed by a String.

getAuditLogger

ContextLogger getAuditLogger()
Provides audit logging capabilities. This is different than the system logging capabilities provided by ContextLogger. The audit log statements are governed by and viewed in the management application. Each log statement has a different level of importance or purpose, debug, warning, or error in that order. These statements will only be seen in the log if the handler is invoked with a level equal to or greater than that statement.

Returns:
Logger.

setAuditLogger

void setAuditLogger(ContextLogger logger)
Associates an audit logger with the exchange.

Parameters:
logger - Logger.
